net.cloud.server.util

Class SimpleDateTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.util.SimpleDateTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bufferable

    public class SimpleDateTime
extends Object
implements Bufferable
    Both the SimpleDate and SimpleTime combined into one, for when you need a date AND a time

      • save

        public void save(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        Description copied from interface: Bufferable
        Pack the object into a ByteBuf. This should write all information necessary for load(buffer) to restore the object. If another object needs to be saved, then it should also implement Bufferable so that the calls can travel down the hierarchy (and load can restore them through the same hierarchy)
        If this is not an option, it's okay to use some other means - such as bridging Java's own serialization
        Specified by:
        save in interface Bufferable
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to place all necessary data into

      • restore

        public void restore(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        Description copied from interface: Bufferable
        Restore an object using the data in the buffer. All of the information needed should have been written via save(buffer). This should not modify the buffer, only read from it. There may be more data in the buffer than is needed to restore - don't mutate that in any way - or the code reading after this call may break.
        The idea is that restoration happens on an object that has already been created, so it may be necessary to refer to some factory methods or some other construction means if simple constructor usage is not viable.
        Specified by:
        restore in interface Bufferable
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read all necessary data from
